column4: Hey. Im having a problem with my Audigy and Live soundcard, I cant get no digital output out of em. I have an extern DAC and it recieves the signal (48khz) when I turn on the "Audigy Analog/Digital" Switch on, so its not the cable/signal. But i get no sound out of it, what am I doing wrong? (PS. I'm newbie, so :>)
I get the same problem with both cards.
you need to use the alsamixer to unmute and use the digital outs
open a terminal and type: alsamixer
how do i unmute it there? its just writing "00" and i cant turn it up or anything.
OO means it's unmuted
should say for the item: "SB Live Analog/Digital Output Jack"
yeah, it does. when i press "," it writes "mm", and the DAC losses the signal. But still no sound when i switch it on again :(
hrm..
ok, you may need to change the output device in your program from hw:0,0 to hw:0,2
some more detailed info here: http://alsa.opensrc.org/index.php/DigitalOut
that didnt work either, XMMS just complains that the device is blocked by an another application =(
what about hw:0,3?
you may need to stop the song, open the preferences, set the output channel, apply/ok, then play the song again

i did, same problem, with 0,3/0,4/0,5 its the same problem, it cant play the song because of hardware in use, but with the 0,1 there is no problem with playing, but no sound is coming out of the speaker.
what other audio programs do you have running? any sound servers?
nothing, xmms is the only application, besides x-chat
and nothing on that website makes a difference?
Nope, it can play with spdif and iec958, but still no sound is coming out of the speakers :(
man.. wish i had a digital connection to test with :/
i have the out, just not the equipment
hehe, its allright, but thanks for help anyway :>
good luck with that
